main_definition: Compensation refers to something given or received as payment, reward, or reparation for a service, loss, injury, or inconvenience.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Payment received after losing an employee
meanings_and_examples.example: The company decided to provide compensation in the form of severance pay and benefits to employees who were laid off.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Compensation for damages or losses suffered due to someone else's actions
meanings_and_examples.example: The court awarded financial compensation to the victim for the pain and suffering caused by a car accident.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Payment given as rewards for good performance or achievements at work
meanings_and_examples.example: At the end of the year, employees received bonuses and raises as part of their compensation package.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Something done to make up for a mistake or wrongdoing
meanings_and_examples.example: The company offered free products and services as compensation for the inconvenience caused by their defective product.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Fairness in payment between men and women for equal work
meanings_and_examples.example: Gender pay gap refers to the disparity in compensation received by men and women who perform similar jobs and duties.
